example.name: Name of the Event
example.notes: types, desc, and notes optional. frequency is how many times it would happen on earth, on average. corresponding probs are autocalced. type numbers are dimensionless weights, acceptable iff their sum is a nonzero real.

bio.name: Emergence of Life
bio.desc: The breath of life was first breathed into a cell this era.

bio.name: Emergence of Sexual Reproduction
bio.desc: The first cells had fun together in this era.

bio.name: Multicellular Life
bio.desc: A few cells have begun to form colonies.

bio.name: Like_Cambrian
bio.desc: The abrupt emergence of numerous taxa during this era is noted.

bio.name: Life on Land
bio.desc: The first living things have taken root on the land.

geo.name: Mass-Extinction Event
geo.desc: An abrupt decrease in taxa is noted in the geologic record.

geo.name: Snowball World
geo.desc: Most if not all of the world was frozen over briefly.

geo.name: Geomagnetic Reversal
geo.desc: The poles abruptly switched places in this era.
